author: Katherine Dhurandhar
title: Labor Day Weekend in Westchester: Best Things To Do - Mommy Poppins
text:
OUR LATEST VIDEOS
Labor Day Weekend 2025 in Westchester and the Hudson Valley: Best Things To Do with Kids
Katherine Dhurandhar
Looking for the best things to do in Westchester and the Hudson Valley this Labor Day weekend? Here are some family-friendly events and activities to add to your list for the holiday weekend.
It's Labor Day weekend and time for one last summer hurrah! Take a ride in a hot air balloon or just enjoy the spectacle as they fill the sky at the Hudson Valley Hot Air Balloon Festival, which also includes fireworks, live music, helicopter rides, inflatables, and more. Or, watch the FREE fireworks shows at the Newburgh International Festival or at the West Point Band's Labor Day Concert.
Families can also celebrate the end-of-summer corn harvest at Uncle Shoehorn's Funky Corn Festival at Wright Family Farms, or start the fall festivities, including apple picking, hayrides, bounce houses, farm animals, and a pumpkin patch, at Outhouse Orchards' Fall Festival.
As the countdown to September begins, check out our end-of-summer bucket list for top things to do before school starts in Westchester and the Hudson Valley.
More Things To Do in Westchester and the Hudson Valley this Week with Kids:
As always, please click through our listings to confirm details—including dates, times, recommended ages, and any last-minute changes—before heading out.
Places featured in this article:
Tymor Park
Delano-Hitch Recreation Park
Luangisa African Gallery
Ulster County Fairgrounds
Westmoreland Sanctuary Nature Center and Wildlife Preserve
Twin Star Orchards
Trophy Point Amphitheater
Bethel Woods Center for the Arts
St. Paul's Church National Historic Site
Pound Ridge
